with labored breathing, so Chapman immediately radioed for medical help.{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bs-md-ci-police-radio-calls-20130722-story.html#ixzz2aHXpHHWg |title=Police release recordings from traffic stop death |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Justin|last=Fenton|date=July 22, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} As supervising Officer Corey Jennings arrived to find West unresponsive, he removed his handcuffs, turned him over, and immediately started [[cardiopulmonary resuscitation|CPR]].{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/02/11/baltimores-top-prosecutors-releases-interviews-in-controversial-death-in-custody-case/ |title=Key Interviews Released In Controversial Baltimore City Death-In-Custody Case |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Mike|last=Hellgren|date=February 11, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} EMT personnel arrived within five minutes and CPR was performed for about 20 minutes.{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Continuing lifesaving measures, they transported West to [[MedStar Good Samaritan Hospital|Good Samaritan Hospital]] where he was eventually pronounced dead at 8:11 p.m.{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/02/11/baltimores-top-prosecutors-releases-interviews-in-controversial-death-in-custody-case/ |title=Key Interviews Released In Controversial Baltimore City Death-In-Custody Case |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Mike|last=Hellgren|date=February 11, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Tyrone's younger sister Tawanda Jones recalls feeling a sharp pain on the right side of her neck at precisely 7:00 p.m. similar to the effect that twins claim to experience.{{cite web |url=https://www.theodysseyonline.com/story-tyrone-west-sister-fighting-justice|title=The Story of Tyrone West, and the Sister Who Keeps Fighting for Justice|work=TheOdysseyOnline.com| first=Sheridan|last=Merrick|date=March 20, 2017|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The pain and resulting numbness subsided ten minutes later when she immediately told her fiancé that she felt like something had happened to her brother.{{cite web |url=https://www.theodysseyonline.com/story-tyrone-west-sister-fighting-justice|title=The Story of Tyrone West, and the Sister Who Keeps Fighting for Justice|work=TheOdysseyOnline.com| first=Sheridan|last=Merrick|date=March 20, 2017|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} When the local news ran the story at 10:00 p.m. that evening, Jones and family recognized Tyrone's body before they were notified by law enforcement.{{cite web |url=https://www.theodysseyonline.com/story-tyrone-west-sister-fighting-justice|title=The Story of Tyrone West, and the Sister Who Keeps Fighting for Justice|work=TheOdysseyOnline.com| first=Sheridan|last=Merrick|date=March 20, 2017|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ==Investigation== ===Autopsy=== An autopsy was performed the following day at 9:00 a.m. at the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner for the State of Maryland.{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/02/11/baltimores-top-prosecutors-releases-interviews-in-controversial-death-in-custody-case/ |title=Key Interviews Released In Controversial Baltimore City Death-In-Custody Case |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Mike|last=Hellgren|date=February 11, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Chief medical examiner David Fowler determined that West died of cardiac arrhythmia when his heart suddenly stopped beating exacerbated by dehydration, a heart condition, and excessively high temperatures.{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/02/11/baltimores-top-prosecutors-releases-interviews-in-controversial-death-in-custody-case/ |title=Key Interviews Released In Controversial Baltimore City Death-In-Custody Case |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Mike|last=Hellgren|date=February 11, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Neither asphyxia nor trauma from the fight were found to be causes of death.{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/02/11/baltimores-top-prosecutors-releases-interviews-in-controversial-death-in-custody-case/ |title=Key Interviews Released In Controversial Baltimore City Death-In-Custody Case |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Mike|last=Hellgren|date=February 11, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Additionally, West's urine tested positive for cocaine.{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/02/11/baltimores-top-prosecutors-releases-interviews-in-controversial-death-in-custody-case/ |title=Key Interviews Released In Controversial Baltimore City Death-In-Custody Case |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Mike|last=Hellgren|date=February 11, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The medical examiner declined to release the results of the autopsy, even to the family, citing the incomplete and ongoing criminal investigation.{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/12/02/medical-examiner-wont-release-autopsy-of-man-who-died-in-police-custody/ |title=Medical Examiner Won’t Release Autopsy Of Man Who Died In Police Custody|work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Kai|last=Jackson|date=December 2, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Six months later at a press conference on December 10, 2013, the autopsy results were finally announced.{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/12/10/autopsy-finds-baltimore-man-died-in-police-custody-due-to-heart-failure-dehydration/ |title=Autopsy: Baltimore Man Died In Police Custody Due To Heart Failure, Dehydration|work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Derek|last=Valcourt|date=December 10, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ===Internal investigation=== Mayor Rawlings-Blake stated, “I have charged the Baltimore Police Department to conduct an internal investigation in an effort to further evaluate details surrounding this case and to hold anyone found of any wrongdoing accountable for their actions.”{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/12/19/family-cries-cover-up-no-criminal-charges-filed-against-officers-in-death-of-tyrone-west/|title=Family Cries Cover-Up: No Criminal Charges Filed Against Officers In Death Of Tyrone West |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Meghan|last=McCorkell |date=December 19, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Eight city officers were suspended during dual investigations, an internal review by the police and a separate review by the State's Attorney's Office.{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/12/10/autopsy-finds-baltimore-man-died-in-police-custody-due-to-heart-failure-dehydration/ |title=Autopsy: Baltimore Man Died In Police Custody Due To Heart Failure, Dehydration|work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Derek|last=Valcourt|date=December 10, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bs-md-ci-police-radio-calls-20130722-story.html#ixzz2aHXpHHWg |title=Police release recordings from traffic stop death |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Justin|last=Fenton|date=July 22, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/12/19/family-cries-cover-up-no-criminal-charges-filed-against-officers-in-death-of-tyrone-west/|title=Family Cries Cover-Up: No Criminal Charges Filed Against Officers In Death Of Tyrone West |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Meghan|last=McCorkell |date=December 19, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Following routine guidelines, they were restricted to administrative assignments pending the outcome of the investigation.{{cite web |url= http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bs-md-ci-police-radio-calls-20130722-story.html#ixzz2aHXpHHWg |title=Police release recordings from traffic stop death |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Justin|last=Fenton|date=July 22, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} In December 2013, city prosecutors concluded there was not enough evidence to file criminal charges against any of the officers.{{cite web |url=http://amp.wbaltv.com/article/prosecutors-will-not-reopen-tyrone-west-case/7100067|title=Prosecutors will not reopen Tyrone West case |work=WBALTV.com|date=April 14, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The State's Attorney's Office concluded that the use of batons, pepper spray, and physical force were justified in subduing West.{{cite web |url=http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/06/23/family-of-baltimore-man-who-died-in-custody-files-multi-million-suit-against-police/ |title=Family Of Baltimore Man Who Died In Custody Files Multimillion Dollar Lawsuit Against Police |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com|date=June 23, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/02/11/baltimores-top-prosecutors-releases-interviews-in-controversial-death-in-custody-case/ |title=Key Interviews Released In Controversial Baltimore City Death-In-Custody Case |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Mike|last=Hellgren|date=February 11, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} State's Attorney Gregg L. Bernstein stated, “Mr. West ignored repeated verbal commands by the officers and fought with them over an extended period of time.”{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/12/19/family-cries-cover-up-no-criminal-charges-filed-against-officers-in-death-of-tyrone-west/|title=Family Cries Cover-Up: No Criminal Charges Filed Against Officers In Death Of Tyrone West |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Meghan|last=McCorkell |date=December 19, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Cell phone video turned over by a witness verified that West was continually resisting arrest.{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/12/10/autopsy-finds-baltimore-man-died-in-police-custody-due-to-heart-failure-dehydration/ |title=Autopsy: Baltimore Man Died In Police Custody Due To Heart Failure, Dehydration|work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Derek|last=Valcourt|date=December 10, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} City police hired an independent commission to conduct a third review that also confirmed the officers’ innocence.{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/baltimore-city/bs-md-ci-tyrone-west-20131219-story.html |title=Officers in Tyrone West death will not be charged |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Ian|last=Duncan|date=December 19, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/02/11/baltimores-top-prosecutors-releases-interviews-in-controversial-death-in-custody-case/ |title=Key Interviews Released In Controversial Baltimore City Death-In-Custody Case |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Mike|last=Hellgren|date=February 11, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ==Impact== ===Family reaction=== Every Wednesday since the death of Tyrone West on Thursday, July 18, 2013, his sister Tawanda Jones has led family members and supporters in weekly demonstration to keep the spotlight on her brother.{{cite web |url=https://www.theodysseyonline.com/story-tyrone-west-sister-fighting-justice|title=The Story of Tyrone West, and the Sister Who Keeps Fighting for Justice|work=TheOdysseyOnline.com| first=Sheridan|last=Merrick|date=March 20, 2017|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Beginning on Wednesday, July 24, 2013, a prayer vigil was held by the community at the intersection, the weekly gathering continuing to the present time under the name West Wednesdays.{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/07/23/dispatch-calls-released-after-man-dies-in-police-custody/ |title=Dispatch Calls Released After Man Dies In Police Custody|work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Monique|last=Griego|date=July 23, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.theodysseyonline.com/story-tyrone-west-sister-fighting-justice|title=The Story of Tyrone West, and the Sister Who Keeps Fighting for Justice|work=TheOdysseyOnline.com| first=Sheridan|last=Merrick|date=March 20, 2017|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The family of West alleged that some of the officers in the case were also present during the death of Anthony Anderson on September 21, 2012, a Baltimore resident who died during a police encounter, but none of the officers were actually involved.{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} On June 23, 2014, the family of Tyrone West filed a multimillion-dollar federal lawsuit against 11 officers, the city of Baltimore's police commissioner Anthony W. Batts, and the police chief at Morgan State University.{{cite web |url=http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/06/23/family-of-baltimore-man-who-died-in-custody-files-multi-million-suit-against-police/ |title=Family Of Baltimore Man Who Died In Custody Files Multimillion Dollar Lawsuit Against Police |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com|date=June 23, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} They cited assault, violation of civil rights, and wrongful death.{{cite web |url=http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2014/06/23/family-of-baltimore-man-who-died-in-custody-files-multi-million-suit-against-police/ |title=Family Of Baltimore Man Who Died In Custody Files Multimillion Dollar Lawsuit Against Police |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com|date=June 23, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ===Changes in police procedure=== At the conclusion of their internal investigation, the Baltimore Police stated, “While the criminal review of this difficult situation comes to an end, the internal evaluation of our tactics continues as we seek ways to improve.”{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/12/19/family-cries-cover-up-no-criminal-charges-filed-against-officers-in-death-of-tyrone-west/|title=Family Cries Cover-Up: No Criminal Charges Filed Against Officers In Death Of Tyrone West |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Meghan|last=McCorkell |date=December 19, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Influenced by the deaths of Anthony Anderson in 2012 and Tyrone West in 2013, the police department created a reform model to improve training and the investigation of in-custody deaths.{{cite web |url= http://baltimore.cbslocal.com/2013/12/10/baltimore-police-department-to-change-the-way-they-deal-with-deaths-in-police-custody/ |title=Baltimore Police Department To Change The Way They Deal With Deaths In Police Custody |work=Baltimore.CBSlocal.com| first=Monique|last=Griego|date=December 10, 2013|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The case also influenced change in department policy including limiting physical exertion during heat warnings, placing suspects in a sitting position after being handcuffed, and the use of tasers to subdue subjects with non-lethal force.{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Plainclothes officers patrolling North Baltimore were discontinued and police in uniform with much greater experience and minimum requirements were recruited to patrol.{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ===Independent investigation=== In 2014, Mayor Stephanie Rawlings-Blake commissioned another review of the case.{{cite web |url=https://www.theodysseyonline.com/story-tyrone-west-sister-fighting-justice|title=The Story of Tyrone West, and the Sister Who Keeps Fighting for Justice|work=TheOdysseyOnline.com| first=Sheridan|last=Merrick|date=March 20, 2017|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The independent review board was chaired by James K. Stewart and five doctors.{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} They unanimously determined in August 2014 that West died suddenly while engaged in an extended period of resisting a lawful arrest, that excessive force was not used and did not contribute to the death of Tyrone West, but that officers did not completely follow protocol.{{cite web |url=http://amp.wbaltv.com/article/prosecutors-will-not-reopen-tyrone-west-case/7100067|title=Prosecutors will not reopen Tyrone West case |work=WBALTV.com|date=April 14, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.theodysseyonline.com/story-tyrone-west-sister-fighting-justice|title=The Story of Tyrone West, and the Sister Who Keeps Fighting for Justice|work=TheOdysseyOnline.com| first=Sheridan|last=Merrick|date=March 20, 2017|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The board concluded that West died of cardiac arrhythmia due to cardiac conduction system abnormality aggravated by his struggle with police and dehydration during his restraint.{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.theodysseyonline.com/story-tyrone-west-sister-fighting-justice|title=The Story of Tyrone West, and the Sister Who Keeps Fighting for Justice|work=TheOdysseyOnline.com| first=Sheridan|last=Merrick|date=March 20, 2017|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The extreme environmental temperatures and heat index in the low 100s were also cited as a potential factor.{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The board also made 34 recommendations to improve training and officer accountability within the Baltimore Police Department.{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The panel determined that police did not follow basic policies and made tactical errors that potentially worsened the situation, including a lack of respect for motorists who are stopped in the neighborhood. The review identified the initial departure from protocol as the moment Chapman left his partner alone before backup arrived to begin lawfully searching the vehicle.{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Additionally, the pepper spray that incapacitated the officers should have been deployed when the suspect was at least three feet away, rather than in close proximity.{{cite web |url=https://www.scribd.com/document/236257430/Baltimore-Police-independent-report-into-Tyrone-West-death |title=Baltimore Police independent report into Tyrone West death |work=Scribd.com|date=August 8, 2014|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ===Ensuing protests=== The friction between the Baltimore Police Department and inner-city Baltimore residents was finally thrust into the national spotlight with the [[death of Freddie Gray]] in April 2015. The growing tension in Baltimore, influence by the death of Tyrone West and more directly by Freddie Gray, bubbled over in 2015 resulting in demonstrations and rioting. The death of Freddie Gray prompted the [[United States Department of Justice|U.S. Department of Justice]] to investigate the police department, determining in a report on August 10, 2016, that there existed cases of excessive use of force, unlawful arrests, and discrimination against African Americans.{{cite web |url=http://www.wbal.com/article/208580/3/new-autopsy-on-tyrone-west-finds-he-died-of-asphyxiation-while-restrained|title=New Autopsy On Tyrone West Finds He Died Of Asphyxiation While Restrained|work=WBAL.com|date=December 14, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Tawanda Jones eventually met with the family of Freddie Gray and Attorney General Loretta Lynch who promised to look into the Tyrone West case. ==Controversy== ===Second autopsy=== In 2015, the West family attorney Dwight Petit hired Dr. William Manion to conduct an independent forensic investigation of Tyrone West's autopsy.{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.wbal.com/article/208580/3/new-autopsy-on-tyrone-west-finds-he-died-of-asphyxiation-while-restrained|title=New Autopsy On Tyrone West Finds He Died Of Asphyxiation While Restrained|work=WBAL.com|date=December 14, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Manion, the chief of pathology at [[Memorial Hospital of Salem County|Memorial Hospital]] in [[Salem County, New Jersey]], concluded that he died by suffocation as a result of the way police restrained him, calling it positional asphyxia.{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} This contradicted earlier assertions that he died of a heart condition.{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Dr. Manion acknowledged the cardiac abnormality but did not believe it contributed to the death of West, submitting his findings in November 2015.{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=https://www.theodysseyonline.com/story-tyrone-west-sister-fighting-justice|title=The Story of Tyrone West, and the Sister Who Keeps Fighting for Justice|work=TheOdysseyOnline.com| first=Sheridan|last=Merrick|date=March 20, 2017|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ===State’s Attorney’s office response=== In 2013, Assistant State's Attorney Marilyn Mosby defeated State's Attorney Gregg L. Bernstein, winning the election over the attorney who failed to bring charges in the West case.{{cite web |url=https://thinkprogress.org/amp/p/871b5d93d166?gi=570dd695ad13 |title=Her Brother Was Killed By The Baltimore Police Two Years Ago. Then Things Got Worse.|work=ThinkProgress.org| first=Kira|last=Lerner|date=June 11, 2015|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Mosby was heralded as a champion for change after bringing charges against officers in the Freddie Gray case in 2015.{{cite web |url=https://thinkprogress.org/amp/p/871b5d93d166?gi=570dd695ad13 |title=Her Brother Was Killed By The Baltimore Police Two Years Ago. Then Things Got Worse.|work=ThinkProgress.org| first=Kira|last=Lerner|date=June 11, 2015|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} On April 14, 2016, Mosby announced she would not reopen the investigation into the death of Tyrone West citing there is no additional evidence to contradict the previous findings.{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/bs-md-custody-death-20160430-story,amp.html |title=Report: Heart condition didn’t cause Tyrone West’s death in custody |work=BaltimoreSun.com|first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 30, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}}{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bs-md-ci-tyrone-west-mosby-20160414-story,amp.html |title=Mosby: Tyrone West case won’t be reopened unless new evidence emerges |work=BaltimoreSun.com| first=Justin |last=Fenton |date=April 14, 2016 |accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Mosby personally called Tawanda Jones to deliver the news.{{cite web |url=http://www.baltimoresun.com/news/maryland/crime/bs-md-ci-tyrone-west-mosby-20160414-story,amp.html |title=Mosby: Tyrone West case won’t be reopened unless new evidence emerges |work=BaltimoreSun.com| first=Justin |last=Fenton |date=April 14, 2016 |accessdate=May 31, 2017}} After three separate investigations confirmed the innocence of the officers involved, State's Attorney's spokeswoman Rochelle Ritchie announced that the case would not be reopened.{{cite web |url=http://amp.wbaltv.com/article/prosecutors-will-not-reopen-tyrone-west-case/7100067|title=Prosecutors will not reopen Tyrone West case |work=WBALTV.com|date=April 14, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ===Third autopsy=== Another independent autopsy was conducted in June 2016 by Dr. Adel Shaker, a former medical examiner in [[Alabama]] and [[Mississippi]].{{cite web |url=http://www.wbal.com/article/208580/3/new-autopsy-on-tyrone-west-finds-he-died-of-asphyxiation-while-restrained|title=New Autopsy On Tyrone West Finds He Died Of Asphyxiation While Restrained|work=WBAL.com|date=December 14, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} Shaker also concluded that death was caused by positional asphyxia, suffocation from being restrained in a prone position.{{cite web |url=http://www.wbal.com/article/208580/3/new-autopsy-on-tyrone-west-finds-he-died-of-asphyxiation-while-restrained|title=New Autopsy On Tyrone West Finds He Died Of Asphyxiation While Restrained|work=WBAL.com|date=December 14, 2016|accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ===Missing evidence=== The drugs confiscated from the car driven by Tyrone West have been lost by the Baltimore Police Department.{{cite web |url=https://www.usnews.com/news/best-states/maryland/articles/2017-04-18/family-of-man-who-died-in-custody-evidence-missing-in-case|title=Family of Man Who Died in Custody: Evidence Missing in Case|work=USNews.com |first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 18, 2017 |accessdate=May 31, 2017}} The evidence was discovered missing when attorneys for the West family [[subpoena|subpoenaed]] the department to inspect the cocaine recovered at the scene, only to find it had disappeared.{{cite web |url=https://www.usnews.com/news/best-states/maryland/articles/2017-04-18/family-of-man-who-died-in-custody-evidence-missing-in-case|title=Family of Man Who Died in Custody: Evidence Missing in Case|work=USNews.com |first=Juliet|last=Linderman|date=April 18, 2017 |accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ===National television=== The case of Tyrone West gained national notoriety when his family appeared in the opening episode of the television series ''American Race''.{{cite web |url=https://www.newsday.com/amp/sports/basketball/charles-barkley-shows-his-serious-side-in-american-race-1.13567359|title=Charles Barkley shows his serious side in ‘American Race’|work=NewsDay.com |first=Neil |last=Best |date=May 6, 2017 |accessdate=May 31, 2017}} They confronted the show's host, ex-[[National Basketball Association|NBA]] star Charles Barkley, who has frequently expressed support for both the black community and urban police departments while hoping for both to work together.{{cite web |url=http://ftw.usatoday.com/2016/07/charles-barkley-police-shootings-wild-west-nba|title=Charles Barkley defends stance on police: ‘We’d be living in the Wild Wild West’ without cops|work=USAToday.com |first=Andrew|last=Joseph|date=July 26, 2016 |accessdate=May 31, 2017}} ==See also== {{Portal|Maryland}} *[[2015 Baltimore protests]] *[[Death of Freddie Gray]] *[[List of killings by law enforcement officers in the United States, July 2013]] ==References== {{reflist|30em}} == External links == *[https://www.ushrnetwork.org/sites/ushrnetwork.org/files/tawanda_jones_sister_of_tyrone_west.pdf Letter] from Tawanda Jones to the United Nations in 2015 {{Black Lives Matter}} {{Baltimore Police Department}} {{DEFAULTSORT:West, Tyrone}} [[Category:1969 births]] [[Category:2013 deaths]] [[Category:2013 in Maryland]] [[Category:21st century in Baltimore]] [[Category:African-American history in {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2014}} {{Use Australian English|date=April 2014}} {{Infobox Government agency |agency_name = Department of Child Protection |logo = |logo_width = |logo_caption = |seal = |seal_width = |seal_caption = |formed = 1 July 2007 |preceding1 = [[Department for Community Development]] |preceding2 = [[Department for Family and Children's Services]] |dissolved = |superseding = |jurisdiction = [[Government of Western Australia]] |employees = |chief1_name = |chief1_position = |parent_agency = |child_agency = |website = [http://www.dcp.wa.gov.au/Pages/Home.aspx www.dcp.wa.gov.au] |footnotes = }} '''Department for Child Protection''' is part of the [[Government of Western Australia]].
It was created in response to a critical review of the [[Department of Community Development]] in January 2007.<ref name=SRO>{{cite web|url=https://archive.sro.wa.gov.au/index.php/department-for-child-protection-au-wa-a1504|title=AU WA A1504 - Department for Child Protection|publisher=State Records Office of WA|access-date=4 June 2018}}</ref><ref>http://www.mediastatements.wa.gov.au/Lists/Statements/DispForm.aspx?ID=125741</ref> At the time of its establishment, the government also mandated reporting of [[child sexual abuse]].
==Responsibilities== The Department administers Acts and Regulations which include the following:<ref>http://www.dcp.wa.gov.au/Organisation/Pages/Legislation.aspx</ref> * Adoption Act 1994 * Adoption Regulations 1995 * Children and Community Services Act 2004 * Children and Community Services Regulations 2006 * Parental Support and Responsibility Act 2008 * Parental Support and Responsibility Regulations 2009 * Working with Children (Criminal Record Checking) Act 2004 * Working with Children (Criminal Record Checking) Regulations 2005.<ref>http://www.checkwwc.wa.gov.au/checkwwc</ref>
The Children and Community Services Act 2004, came into operation on 1 March 2006,<ref>http://www.dcp.wa.gov.au/Organisation/Pages/Legislation.aspx</ref> the Department came into existence on 1 July 2007<ref name=SRO/>
The legislation that governs the Department’s three service areas:
* Supporting children and young people in the Chief Executive Officer’s care. * Protecting children and young people from abuse. * Supporting individuals and families at risk or in crisis.
The Department also has the capacity for information sharing where it benefits child protection<ref>{{Citation | author1=Western Australia. Dept. for Child Protection | title=Working together for a better future for at risk children and families : a guide on information sharing for government and non-government agencies | publication-date=2009 | publisher=Department for Child Protection | isbn=978-0-9806964-0-0 }}</ref>
==Former agencies == (Other agencies might have had overlap in relation to Aboriginal children, but these are the main names<ref name=SRO/><ref>http://www.findandconnect.gov.au/wa/biogs/WE00360b.htm</ref> * 1908 - 1917 Public Charities and State Children's Department * 1917 - 1927 State Children's Department * 1927 - 1972 Child Welfare Department * 1972 - 1985 Department for Community Welfare * 1985 - 1992 Department for Community Services * 1992 - 1995 Department for Community Development * 1995 - 2001 Department for Family and Children's Services * 2001 - 2007 Department for Community Development
==See also== * [[Aboriginal child protection#Australia]]
==Notes== {{reflist|2}}
==External links== * http://www.dcp.wa.gov.au/Pages/Home.aspx - the Departments main website

{{Infobox person | honorific_prefix = Princess | name = Devi Thant Sin | native_name = {{my|ဒေဝီသန့်စင်}} | image = Devi Thant Sin.jpg | alt = | caption = Devi Thant Sin in 2016 | birth_name = | other_names = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1947|1|2|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Yangon|Rangoon]], [[British rule in Burma|British Burma]]
{{small|(now Yangon)}} | residence = [[Yangon]], [[Myanmar]] | death_date = | death_place = | death_cause = | resting_place = | nationality = [[Myanmar|Burmese]] | ethnicity = | religion = | known_for = Green Princess | occupation = [[Environmentalist]], [[Writer]], [[Princess]] | parents = [[Taw Phaya Galay]]
Khin May | spouse = Aye Ko | children = | alma_mater = | awards = | url = }} '''Devi Thant Sin''' ({{lang-my|ဒေဝီသန့်စင်}}, also spelt '''Devi Thant Cin'''; born 2 January 1947) is a [[Myanmar|Burmese]] [[environmentalist]], writer and the leader of the [[Environmental movement]] in Burma. She against the [[Myitsone dam|Myitsone hydropower dam]], a controversial project backed by [[China]] at the mouth of the [[Irrawaddy River]]. She is founder of the ''Global Green Group'' (3G) and ''Myanmar Green Network''.{{cite web|url=http://www.aecen.org/node/2096|title='We do not accept the government’s clean coal technology’/Devi Thant Cin Q&A Interview|work=Asian Environmental Compliance and Enforcement Network|date=7 January 2017|accessdate=3 November 2017|language=en}} ==Background Image== Devi Thant Sin was born in [[Yangon]], [[British Burma]] to Prince [[Taw Phaya Galay]] and Khin May. She is not only known for being a leading [[environmentalist]], but also as a Burmese princess and direct descendant of Myanmar's last monarch [[King Thibaw]] and Queen [[Supayalat]].{{cite web|url=http://www.royalark.net/Burma/konbau19.htm |title=The Konbaung Dynasty (part 19) |publisher=Royal Ark |date= |accessdate=2012-02-15}}{{cite web|url=https://www.mmtimes.com/lifestyle/13490-descended-from-royalty.html|title=Descended from royalty|work=[[The Myanmar Times]]|date=12 March 2015|author=Zon Pann Pwint|accessdate=3 November 2017|language=en}} ==Career and movements== She is considered one of Myanmar's first [[environmentalists]] and works to fight deforestation and environmental degradation in the Southeast Asian nation. She is a leading light in Myanmar's fledgling green movements. In a country where the focus is on much-needed development of the economy rather than protecting its resources, the work of environmentalists. She is the founder of the environmental activist organizations Global Green Group (3G) and the Myanmar Green Network. She despite having lived the life of a commoner, she still considers it her duty to look after the interests of the Burmese people by fighting to protect the environment.{{cite web|url=https://www.irrawaddy.com/opinion/the-irrawaddy-river-is-like-a-mother.html|title=‘The Irrawaddy River Is Like a Mother’|work=[[The Irrawaddy]]|date=15 June 2013|author=Kyaw Phyo Tha|accessdate=3 November 2017|language=en}} Thant Sin first started writing about environmental awareness in the early 2000s. In 2007 she launched her own which was Myanmar's first environmental magazine, “Aung Pin Lae”, the magazine inform the public of the global green movement and environmental degradation in the country. She also began travelling through the country to give talks to farmers about the risk of using chemical fertilizers, while she spoke with students to inform the younger generation of environmental concerns. She was to help unify Myanmar's burgeoning green movement. She gathered together the country's handful of environmental activists in 2006 to form the Global Green Group (3G), followed closely by the Myanmar Green Network. The group is made up of shifting numbers of mining engineers, meteorologists, lawyers, civil engineers, activists, researchers and journalists.{{cite web|url=http://www.mizzima.com/news-opinion/‘we-do-not-accept-government’s-clean-coal-technology’|title=Devi Thant Cin Q&A|work=[[Mizzima News]]|date=7 January 2016|accessdate=3 November 2017|language=en}} She was against the [[Myitsone Dam|Myitsone hydropower dam]], a controversial project backed by China at the mouth of the [[Irrawaddy River]] in northern [[Kachin State]] that could cause widespread environmental devastation if it goes ahead. She said “''For the whole of Myanmar, the [[Irrawaddy River|Irrawaddy]] is like the mother river, If there is dam construction that they shouldn’t do, we point out that it’s not the time to do it''”. The environmental campaigns against the dam led to a nationwide public outcry, prompting President [[Thein Sein]] to suspend the project in 2011 until 2016, when his presidential term expires. In part thanks to Thant Sin and other protestors’ efforts, the project is currently on hold. ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Devi Thant Sin}} [[Category:1947 births]] [[Category:People from Yangon Region]] [[Category:Konbaung dynasty]] [[Category:Environmentalism]] [[Category:Living people]] {{Myanmar-stub}}

{{Press release|date=June 2011}} {{for|the application software|Adobe Digital Editions}} A '''digital edition''' is an [[online magazine]] or [[online newspaper]] delivered in electronic form which is formatted identically to the print version. Digital editions are often called digital facsimiles to underline the likeness to the print version. Digital editions have the benefit of reduced cost to the publisher and reader by avoiding the time and the expense to print and deliver paper edition.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://greeninc.blogs.nytimes.com/2008/12/02/reading-green-on-demand/|title=Reading Green On Demand|last=Kanter|first=James|publisher=New York Times | date=2008-12-02 | accessdate=2010-05-01}}</ref> This format is considered more environmentally friendly due to the reduction of paper and energy use. These editions also often feature interactive elements such as [[hyperlink]]s both within the publication itself and to other internet resources, search option and bookmarking, and can also incorporate multimedia such as video or animation to enhance articles themselves or for advertisement purposes. Some delivery methods also include animation and sound effects that replicate turning of the page to further enhance the experience of their print counterparts.Traditionally, magazine publishers have relied on two revenue sources: selling ads and selling magazines.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://rorybrown.wordpress.com/2008/12/01/digital-editions-trying-to-solve-the-wrong-business-media-problem/|title=Digital editions: trying to solve the wrong business media problem|accessdate=2009-05-14|date=2008-01-12|publisher=Rory Brown}}</ref> Additionally some publishers are using other electronic publication methods such as [[RSS]] to reach out to readers and inform them when new digital editions are available.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.hawaiireporter.com/story.aspx?ed92812b-bf9f-4872-af4d-e16e267d431e |title=The Future of Newspapers: Moving Beyond Dead Trees |last=Murdoch |first=Rupert |date=2008-11-19 |publisher=Hawaii Reporter |accessdate=2008-12-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081216015103/http://hawaiireporter.com/story.aspx?ed92812b-bf9f-4872-af4d-e16e267d431e |archivedate=December 16, 2008 }}</ref>
Current technologies are generally either reader-based, requiring a download of an application and subsequent download of each edition, or [[Web browser|browser]]-based, often using [[Macromedia Flash]] , requiring no application download (such as [[Adobe Acrobat]]<ref>{{cite web | publisher = Magforum | title = Digital magazines: a history | url=http://www.magforum.com/digital_history.htm | accessdate = 2008-07-01 }}</ref>). Some application-based readers allow users to access editions while not connected to internet. Dedicated hardware such as the [[Amazon Kindle]] and the [[iPad]] is also available for reading digital editions of select books, popular national magazines such as [[Time (magazine)|Time]], [[The Atlantic]], and [[Forbes]] and popular national newspapers such as the [[The New York Times|New York Times]], [[The Wall Street Journal|Wall Street Journal]], and [[the Washington Post|Washington Post]].
Archives of print newspapers, in some cases dating hundreds of years back, are being digitized and made available online. Google is indexing existing digital archives produced by the newspapers themselves or by third parties.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://googleblog.blogspot.com/2008/09/bringing-history-online-one-newspaper.html|title=Bringing History Online, One Newspaper at a Time|publisher=Google|accessdate=2008-12-07}}</ref>
Newspaper and magazine archival is not new with [[microform]] film formats solving the problem of efficiently storing and preserving. This format, however, lacked accessibility. Many libraries, especially state libraries in the United States are archiving their collections digitally and converting existing microfilm to digital format. The [[Library of Congress]] provides project planning assistance<ref>{{cite web|url=http://lcweb2.loc.gov/ammem/prjplan.html|title=National Digital Library Program Project Checklist|accessdate=2008-12-07}}</ref> and the [[National Endowment for the Humanities]] procures funding through grants from its National Digital Newspaper Program.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.neh.gov/grants/guidelines/ndnp.html|title=National Digital Newspaper Program|publisher=National Endowment for the Humanities|accessdate=2008-12-07}}</ref>
Digital magazines, ezines, e-editions and emags are sometimes referred to as digital editions, however some of these formats are published only in digital format unlike digital editions which replicate a printed edition as well.
== Digital magazines ==
Digital-replica magazines number in thousands—consumer and business publications, house magazines for associations, institutions and corporations – and conversion from print to digital was still increasing as of 2009.
A 2008 report funded by digital-replica technology providers and auditing agencies counted 1,786 digital-replica editions having more than 7 million circulation among business-to-business publications, of which 230 editions were audited <ref name="The Gilbane Group, Digital Magazine and Newspaper Editions, May 2008">[http://info.texterity.com/info/2008GilbaneReport#pg1 The Gilbane Group, Digital Magazine and Newspaper Editions, May 2008]</ref> The same report counted 1,470 digital-replica editions of consumer magazines having 5.5 million digital circulation, of which 240 editions were audited. These authors estimated that by year end of 2009 there would be 8,000 digital magazines, having a combined distribution of more than 30 million people.
Surveys have shown that, while not all subscribers prefer a digital edition, some do because of the environmental benefit and also because digital magazines are searchable and may easily be passed along or linked to. One such survey funded by a digital publisher reported on inputs from more than 30,000 subscribers to business, consumer and other digital magazines.<ref name="Texterity, Inc., Profile of the Digital Edition Reader, May 2009">[http://info.texterity.com/info/reader-research/?submit=Click+here+to+View#pg1 Texterity, Inc., Profile of the Digital Edition Reader, May 2009]</ref>
== Digital magazine business models == === Reduced printing and distribution costs ===
The publishers' choice to save by moving some or all subscribers from print to digital is widely accepted. Oracle magazine, which has 176,000 of its 516,000 subscribers receiving digital according to its June 2009 BPA circulation statement, is said to be the most widely circulated digital edition of a business-to-business publication. Publishers who do this need to choose whether to make some issues all-digital, move some subscribers to digital edition, add some digital-only subscribers, or send all subscribers the digital edition.
=== Paid subscription revenue ===
In 2009, a major consumer magazine, PC magazine, went all-digital, charging an annual subscription fee for its digital-replica edition. <ref name="PC Magazine Goes 100% Digital, November 19, 2008">[https://www.pcmag.com/article2/0,2817,2335009,00.asp PC Magazine Goes 100% Digital, November 19, 2008]</ref>
Many consumer magazines and newspapers are already available in eReader formats that are sold through booksellers. === Sponsorship and advertising revenue ===
Digital editions often carry special "front cover" advertising, or advertising on the email message alerting the subscriber of the digital edition. Publishers also produce special digital-only inserts and [[rich-media]] ads or advertorials.{{citation needed|date=March 2011}}
=== Designed-for-digital issues ===
Another approach is to fully replace printed issues with digital ones, or to use digital editions for extra issues that would otherwise have to be printed.{{citation needed|date=March 2011}}
==Notes== {{Reflist|30em}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Digital Edition}} [[Category:Publishing]] [[Category:Digital media]] [[Category:Online magazines]] [[Category:Digital newspapers]] [[Category:Zines]] [[Category:Electronic publishing]]
